featured.text: Often those songs have a simple, upbeat melody and catchy, repetitive lyrics, such as popular commercial jingles and slightly annoying radio hits.
As the melody repeats, it becomes embedded into our mind.
According to this passage, which of the following statements is true? (A) Scary lullabies better help babies fall asleep. (B) Mothers prefer to sing lullabies with a joyful melody.

definition.zh_def: 旋律；音樂的主題或主要部分。
definition.en_def: A sequence of musical notes that are perceived as a single entity, often forming the main theme of a piece of music.
definition.example: The melody of the song was so catchy that everyone started singing along.
